intro: Calophaca cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calophaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Calophaca cuneata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and hardy nature.
